name: Texas Pride
climate: Texas Pride thrives in warm regions, preferring climates that have mild winters and hot summers.
This plant is well-suited for environments that experience plenty of sunshine year-round.
Ideal conditions for Texas Pride include areas with low humidity and dry air.
While it can tolerate some cold, it is best grown in places without extreme frost.
sunlight: Texas Pride requires full sun exposure to grow and bloom properly.
It benefits from at least six to eight hours of direct sunlight each day.
Placing it in a location where it can receive consistent sunlight is ideal.
Insufficient sunlight can lead to poor growth and reduced flowering.
watering: Texas Pride requires moderate watering, allowing the soil to dry between waterings.
Excessive watering can lead to root rot; ensure well-drained conditions.
During the growing season, water regularly but reduce frequency in winter.
Monitor soil moisture and avoid letting it stay constantly wet.
soil: Prefers well-draining soil rich in organic matter to promote healthy roots.
Sandy or loamy soil types are ideal, providing good aeration for the plant.
Soil pH should be mildly acidic to neutral for optimal growth.
Regularly amend soil with compost to maintain nutrients and structure.
